title: Ticket #7872: Convert bosco_findplatform to Python 3
description: bosco_findplatform is currently Python 2 so any EL 8 users are in for a rude surprise if they try to use Bosco. Let's get them converted to over Python 3 if we want this for 8.9-only, or Python 2/3 if we want to backport this to 8.8
remarks:
2020-Oct-19 10:07:16 by tim:
Most of the bosco work is going into 8.9.10. So, let's move this ticket there.

2020-Oct-19 10:16:41 by blin:
Just to note it here so that it doesn't get lost in Slack, TimT and I discussed that at the least, bosco_fiindplatform still needs to fix the references to urllib2 and commands

2020-Nov-02 08:27:58 by tim:
It turns out that platform.dist() was removed from Python 3.8. So, more work is needed.

2020-Nov-11 09:50:12 by tim:
Perhaps use the Python distro package: https://distro.readthedocs.io/en/latest/

2020-Nov-11 11:02:49 by matyas:
How hard would it be to write one? If reading /etc/os-release is sufficient, then it wouldn't be very long and it would avoid the dependency on a PyPI module.

2020-Nov-11 11:38:06 by tim:
Why reinvent the wheel? Just require the python-distro package (or python3-distro) package? No Pypi is needed.

2020-Nov-11 12:04:44 by matyas:
If there's an OS/EPEL package, that's fine -- I just think we should avoid things that need to be pip installed.
